description:
The Far East, 2071.
The domain of the mad gods.

In the early 2050s, unknown life forms called “Oracle cells” begin their uncontrolled consumption of all life on Earth.
Their ravenous appetite and remarkable adaptability earn them first dread, then awe, and finally the name “aragami”.
In the face of an enemy completely immune to conventional weapons, urban civilization collapses, and each day humanity is driven further and further toward extinction.

One single ray of hope remains for humanity.
Following the development of “God Arcs”—living weapons which incorporate Oracle cells—their wielders are organized into an elite force.
In a world ravaged by mad gods, these “God Eaters” fight a desperate war...

(Source: Daisuki)

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cnago) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/椎名豪)

Masaru Shiina, known professionally as Go Shiina, is a freelance composer and arranger.

He joined Namco in 1997, and was best known during his time with the company for writing music for a number of games in the Tales, Mr. Driller, and God Eater franchises, He gained widespread recognition with his score for Tales of Legendia in 2005. Since then, he has also contributed music for several titles in the Tekken, Ace Combat, and The Idolmaster franchises.

In anime he is most noted for the score of [Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba](https://anilist.co/anime/101922/) together with [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/).

[Twitter](https://x.com/hira0takayuk1)

He graduated from Osaka's Designer College and started his career at [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) as a production assistant, later making the transition to storyboarder and episode director with [Texhnolyze](https://anilist.co/anime/26/). During his time at Madhouse he served as Assistant Director to [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/Satoshi-Kon) on [Paranoia Agent](https://anilist.co/anime/323/Paranoia-Agent/) and was greatly influenced by him, regarding him as his mentor. Shortly after leaving Madhouse he joined [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/ufotable), where he worked for several years and made his proper directorial debut with [Kara no Kyoukai 5](https://anilist.co/anime/4282/). 

He left Ufotable in 2016 and he's been freelance since, returning to the company only to direct the opening for the video game Shin Megami Tensei: Strange Journey. 

Him and [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088/) are really close friends since their days at Madhouse. They run a column called *Bariuta no ai wo shiritai!!* published in the Animage monthly magazine. 

He is married to color designer [Emi Chiba](https://anilist.co/staff/103075/).

OLDCODEX was a Japanese rock band from Tokyo, Japan, formed in 2009.

On August 4, 2021, Ta_2 announced he was going on hiatus, with Oldcodex subsequently pausing their activities as well. On December 27, 2021, it was announced that Oldcodex was set to disband following the release of the theme song for the upcoming Free! movie on the original soundtrack album which is scheduled for April 2022. They officially disbanded on May 31, 2022.

__Members:__ 
 - Vocal: Ta_2 ([Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735))
 - Painter, Lyrics: YORKE
 - Drums: Ryo Yamagata
 - Bass Guitar: Taizo Nakamura
 - Guitar: Shinji Oomura


In February 15, 2010, YoHsKE and sae left the band. 
In November 1, 2010, YORKE. who is responsible for the artworks became an official member.  
In October 15, 2012, [R・O・N](https://anilist.co/staff/106037/Ryuuta-Iida) left the band.

[Twitter](https://x.com/hira0takayuk1)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ynaritaka)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/).
Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/GHOST_O_DRIVE)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/898885425028251648/)

Japanese composite artist. Currently working as a freelancer after being affiliated with Asahi Productions from 2011-2022, although he still keeps a desk at the studio for potential collaboration.

While his main focus is photography, he does animate on rare occasions, specifically [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/)-esque effects animation.

Michael McConnohie is an American voice actor, writer and director who has provided many voice roles in movies, anime, and video games. He and fellow actress Melodee Spevack run a production company called VoxWorks. Some of his major works include the Narrator on Bobobo-bo Bo-bobo and Hunter x Hunter, Azulongmon in Digimon, Gork in Masked Rider, Keiichi Ikari in Paranoia Agent, Rolf Emerson in Robotech, Manzou the Saw in Samurai Champloo, Cosmos and Tracks in Transformers, Hot Shot / Ironhide in Transformers: Robots in Disguise, D in Vampire Hunter D, Chief Inquisitor Margulis in Xenosaga and Charles zi Britannia in Code Geass.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Rafael Antonio "Tony" Olivier is a Puerto Rican-born American voice actor best known for voicing Rick Hunter from Robotech, Lancer from Fate/stay night, and Arsène Lupin III from Lupin the Third. He helped produce the live action shows Mighty Morphin Power Rangers and VR Troopers.
Previously the VP of Pioneer Entertainment and Geneon Entertainment, President of Animax of America.

[Twitter](https://x.com/hira0takayuk1)
